nodes.text: Oh no
As far as any future visitor may be concerned, this tomb clearly never contained anything of value.
The sign here is unreadable. That's pretty sad. Whoever's interred inside was counting on a little piece of eternity, and now you can't even read who it was.
It looks like there are some bones and armor in the crypt... and is that some sort of jewelry? It's hard to tell in the darkness.
It's impossible to make anything out without some light. It's just too dark.
It's a Marple Class lock, so it should be relatively easy... that rust is sure to complicate things, though.
The lock itself looks simple... that rust is sure to complicate things, though.
Luckily, the oil I used should help counteract the rust. Glad I had some with me!
You know, looking at these parts, I bet some oil would help.
Between all the oil and the rust, I can't tell what kind of lock this is. It seems pretty simple, though...
I can't really tell what kind of lock this is through all that rust. I guess I had better go study my locks some more.
I've managed to remove most of the rust on the lock with the oil.
It will be hard to pick this lock with all the rust on it.
It's locked. The lock is in terrible shape - it's almost rusted out.
Now let's see what's inside...
Uh oh.

nodes.message: Game is switched to combat against the Skeletal Warrior

nodes.text: Okay, I hope this is safe for some crypt robbing now.
Let's see if there's anything of value left here...
Like this pile of sixty coins!
And a piece of jewelry!
Ah, it's a Necramulet. I thought that it was supposed to protect against Undead - not be buried with them.
Interesting - it looks like an amethyst gem with a skull clasped necklace.
This definitely has something to do with protection against Undead. Why it was buried with one of the Walking Deceased is not something I want to know.
I should write a book - "Grave Robbing for Fun and Profit!"
Speaking of books... there's a book hidden at the bottom of the crypt...
Ugh. I can see why it was hidden. It's an ugly book and it sends chills up and down my spine when I touch it.
Then again, it's probably valuable to someone. Otherwise, why hide it away with an Undead guarding it?
Eh, there's nothing left here to rob.
It's too dark for me to try opening any crypts. Who knows what might be in these things?

There is definitely some strong magic inside this crypt. The bones and armor glow with a magical aura. There's also a glowing purple gem that feels scary. In fact this crypt gives me chills running up and down my spine.

There is definitely some strong magic inside this crypt. I sense a magical aura eminating from something... or things... and there's a scary purple-ish feeling as well. In fact this crypt gives me chills running up and down my spine.
I'll just work this oil into the lock to remove some of the rust...
There... that should do the trick.
This lock cylinder just doesn't want to turn...
Yikes! It broke my wooden lockpick!
There's too much rust on the lock right now.
I'd need a lockpick to open this crypt door.
